cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly west toward the south-Texas coast (mouth of the Rio Grande–Port O’Connor corridor), then inland across southern Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-Texas coast near Baffin Bay / Corpus Christi area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port O’Connor to Sargent, TX (south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O’Connor, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Texas coastline from the mouth of the Rio Grande to Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gale-force gusts possible Tuesday (25–35 mph); sustained tropical-storm winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible in Brazoria/Matagorda bays; significant inundation not expected at the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy showers Tuesday could bring 1–3 inches of rain with localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced rip-current risk and elevated seas through Wednesday
